title: Eugène Charles Catalan
summary: Eugène Charles Catalan (30 May 1814 – 14 February 1894)[2] was a French and Belgian mathematician who worked on continued fractions, descriptive geometry, number theory and combinatorics. His notable contributions included discovering a periodic minimal surface in the space R 3 {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{3}} ; stating the famous Catalan's conjecture, which was eventually proved in 2002; and introducing the Catalan number to solve a combinatorial problem.
